intro: Cyrtandra iaoensis, commonly known as the Iao Mountain Cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in montane rainforests. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
